items.name: Croissant
items.description: It's a very crispy croissant with a lot of puff pastry, and it smells a good taste of butter inside," Duch√™ne says. "A bad croissant is very soft, like a brioche, and you can't have a very good smell of butter, it's not creamy inside‚Ä¶

items.name: Mocha Coffee
items.description: Mocha is a high quality type of coffee made from a specific coffee bean. It's easily confused with the flavored drink also called a mocha, which combines coffee and chocolate.

items.name: Pancakes
items.description: What do you get? Pancakes! How many do you get? One metric stack! That's equivalent to 1000 millistacks, or a tenth of a kilostack. In short, you get a lot of pancakes.

items.name: Bacon
items.description: Bacon is a type of salt-cured pork made from various cuts, typically from the pork belly or from the less fatty back cuts. It is eaten on its own, as a side dish, or used as a minor ingredient to flavour dishes.

items.name: Waffle
items.description: A waffle is a dish made from leavened batter or dough that is cooked between two plates that are patterned to give a characteristic size, shape, and surface impression. ... Waffles may be made fresh or simply heated after having been commercially cooked and frozen.

items.name: Bagel
items.description: A bagel (also spelled beigel) is a type of bread, traditionally shaped by hand into the form of a ring from wheat dough, roughly hand-sized. This dough, which is made with yeast, is first boiled for a short time in water and is then baked.

items.name: Curry and Rice
items.description: Curry and Rice! Curry is a variety of dishes originating in the Indian subcontinent that use a complex combination of spices or herbs, usually including ground turmeric, cumin, coriander, ginger, and fresh or dried chilies.

items.name: Mushroom Tagliatelle
items.description: If you're the kind of fun guy (sorry not sorry) that likes salami-filled Italian food with a twist, this is the perfect dish for you. The twist? We lied about the meat.

items.name: Tower Burger
items.description: It's a truth universally acknowledged that every restaurant is in want of a burger, and trust us: this thing is so tall you can't even get your mouth around it without dislocating your jaw.

items.name: Burrito
items.description: Burritos are filled with a savory filling, most often a meat such as chicken, beef, or pork, and often include a large array of other ingredients such as rice, cooked beans (either whole or refried), vegetables such as lettuce and tomatoes, cheese, and condiments such as salsa, pico de gallo, guacamole, or crema..

items.name: Taco
items.description: Tacos: authentic mexican, great greasy, just regular, nice, fat, drive-through, juicy, leftover, cut-rate, crispy, mexican, vegetarian, nude, inexpensive, petrified, stale, homemade, greasy, lousy, soft, delicious, crisp, hot, terrific, fat, rotten, nice, tough, crazy, handsome, regular.

items.name: Falafel
items.description: Falafel balls are usually made out of chickpeas (also called garbanzo beans), but you can still find other variations depending on where you buy your falafel. The chickpeas are soaked, then ground up, and seasoned with onions, scallions and spices like parsley, garlic, cumin and coriander.

items.name: Pesto Farfalle
items.description: Cheap, filling, and green enough to make you tell yourself that it's healthy, our pesto farfalle is made from 100% recycled bow ties.

items.name: Pita Sandwitch
items.description: Pita bread, sometimes called Arabic bread, is a soft, slightly leavened flatbread that's hugely popular in Middle Eastern cuisine. ... Slice the pita round in half and you have two instant pockets ready to be filled with all manners of sandwich fixings.

items.name: Fillet Steak
items.description: It's a steak. It's not aged, it's not rubbed in kosher salt, it's not "hand-cut" or some other gibberish ‚Äì¬†it's just a slab of cow on a plate. Might come with sweet potato fries if you ask nicely.

items.name: Cheese Toastie
items.description: It's just two slices of bread; not that complicated, really. Oh, and cheese, obviously. Wait‚Ä¶ and bacon it seems? I can't really tell ‚Äì I'm squinting at the picture and it looks like it's bacon. Maybe it's lettuce? Honestly, your guess is as good as mine.

items.name: Pepperoni Pizza
items.description: Our chef spent years trying out various authentic Neapolitan recipes for pizza, but in the end we found this really good frozen thing from Waitrose and we can't tell the difference. If you buy this you'll be in an A/B test where you'll get one of the two served to you.

items.name: Green Salad
items.description: This is literally our pepperoni pizza except we picked off the bits of salami and ran it under a cold tap for a couple of seconds. (Note: might still taste a bit pepperoni-ish.)

items.name: Shaved Ice
items.description: Shave ice or Hawaiian shave ice is an ice-based dessert made by shaving a block of ice. While the product can resemble a snow cone, snow cones are made with crushed, rather than shaved, ice.

items.name: Coke
items.description: Coke contains more carbonation which gives it its distinctive taste that some refer to as ‚Äúbite‚Äù or ‚Äúcrispness‚Äù. It's later in the taste process that your tongue picks up on the flavors and sugar in Coca-cola!

items.name: All Out Donuts
items.description: Donuts! More donuts! And yet more donuts! Exactly how many you get depends on the day ‚Äì¬†we pretty much cram them all on to a plate then see how many we can balance as we walk them to your table.

items.name: Soft Icecream
items.description: This is no regular icecream ‚Äì it's a soft icecream! I think that means it wears glasses and has an unusual fear of kryptonite? Yeah, that sounds about right.

items.name: Virgin Mojito
items.description: The mojito is a classic drink of rum, mint, lime, and soda, but without the rum. So, this is basically an expensive glass of Sprite. We might put an umbrella in it so you don't feel quite so scammed.

items.name: Tropical Drink
items.description: Step 1: Blend some frozen strawberries. Step 3: Profit! If you're reading this it means you've figured out step 2 for yourself.

items.name: Powerhouse coffee
items.description: In the same way that brandy is distilled wine, this is distilled coffee. Yes, we literally boil coffee again and again to remove as much water as possible, leaving some black goopy stuff that is pretty much guaranteed to make your eyes pop.

items.name: Mexican Mocha
items.description: What do you get if you mix spicy Mexican chocolate into coffee? I mean, the answer is pretty much in the name ‚Äì we really ought to get a better marketing team.

items.name: Chrysanthemum Tea
items.description: This is tea made from chrysanthemum. No, we're not quite sure how that works either. Do we press the leaves? Is chrysanthemum even a plant? It sounds like some sort of wild animal. Maybe we milked it to make this drink.

items.name: Straight Up OJ
items.description: What do you get in üç∑a whole bottle of orange juice? This ‚Äì you get this. Fun fact: oranges aren't named that because they are colored orange, but because they are high in the vitamin orangoflavin. (Note: not actually true.)
